prefercite.head: Cite As:

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: This forms a portion of collection #5488 B. The guide to the entire collection is available here.

Series CIV is arranged in 1 sub-series by Union file number.
Series CV is arranged in 344 sub-seires by Union file number.

did.unittitle: General. Record of Transactions of General Chairmen's Memorial Committee
Union representative to be paid on full-time basis by employer for policing contract
When Government takes over operation of any industry, it should also take over the revenues
Amend Railway Labor Act to expedite handling of cases
Endorse Bill H.R. 2945, Parcel Post Rates
Amend Railway Labor Act to speed up negotiations thereunder
Unfair competition of Parcel Post; appoint Express Committee to survey conditions in Express Industry and promote legislation to restrict
Amend Railway Labor Act to provide that employer pay union representative for policing contract
Amend Railway Labor Act to provide more expeditious handling of wage increase requests
Amend Railway Labor Act to provide more expeditious handling of wage increase requests
Endeavor to increase readers' interest in "Railway Clerk"
Strike benefits for our members when out of work because of work stoppages by other organizations.
Employees with 15 years' service to be allowed 15 working days' vacation
Retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service
Retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service; pension benefits to be increased 50%
Liberalize benefits of Railroad Retirement Act
Extend wage increase escalator clause of Railroad Retirement Act to pensioners
Retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service
Amend Unemployment Insurance Act to increase sickness and unemployment benefits
Retirement after 30 years' service; annuity to be based on half of monthly wages of last 5 years
Retirement with $150 per month minimum; optional retirement after 30 years' service or at age 60
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide $100 per month minimum; reduce retirement age to 60; increase maximum deductions from $18 to $10 per month
Retirement after 30 years' service with minimum of $150 per month
Increase benefits of Railroad Retirement Act
Retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide that all costs be paid by management
Retirement after 30 years' service regardless of age, with $100 per month minimum
Amend Unemployment Insurance Act to provide for increased benefits
Voluntary retirement after 30 years' service with $100 per month minimum
Amend Unemployment Insurance Act to provide for liberalized benefits
Retirement after 30 years' service with full pension rights
Retirement after 30 years' service regardless of age; reduce retirement age to 60
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide more liberal benefits
Expression of appreciation for work done by Grand Lodge
Increase vacation allowances based on length of service
Accident insurance for members injured while in service of the Brotherhood
Payment for all legal holidays; 3 weeks' vacation after 15 years' service
Amend Railway Labor Act to prohibit discrimination against any employee because of race, color, or creed
Amend National Vacation Agreement to provide more liberal vacations.
Advise status of grievances every 30 days
5 days' vacation after 1 year's service to 30 days' vacation after 20 years' service
Time and one-half to be paid for worked holidays
Secure same free transportation rights and privileges for Railway Express Agency employees as enjoyed by railroad employees
Work week to be shortened as employee efficiency increases
Brotherhood Lodges urged to affiliate with Central Labor Bodies of American Federation of Labor
Amend National Vacation Agreement to provide more liberal vacations.
Negotiate National Holiday Agreement providing for 7 paid holidays each year
Allow 3 foreign line free transportation passes annually
10 days' vacation for 3 to 10 years' service; 1 additional day for each year thereafter with a maximum of 25 working days' vacation
Revise Lehigh Valley Railroad Working Rules Agreement
15 days' vacation for 15 years' service; 1 additional day for each year thereafter with a maximum of 30 days
Additional Protective Committee Division Chairman for Lodges with 175 or more members
12 days' vacation after 4 years' service to 30 days after 20 years
Free transportation for Railway Express Agency employees
Revise Express Messengers' Rules Agreement to provide not less than 12 working days' vacation with pay per month
12 days' vacation for 4 years to 30 days after 30 years
Railway Express Agency employees to be paid for 7 legal holidays
8-hour work guarantee for Express Messengers for any trip between established railroad terminals
Express Messengers to be paid for all time at away-from-home terminal after 12 hours
Express Messengers to be paid for all time in excess of 170 hours per month at time and one-half rate
Liberalize vacation allowance for Express Messengers
Liberalize foreign line free transportation pass allowances
12 days' vacation after 4 years' service to 30 days for 30 years
Equalize wage rates on similar positions in Railway Express Agency
Revise Vacation Rule, Railway Express Agency
National Holiday and Sick Leave Agreement
9 and 12 days' vacation after 2 and 3 years' service
15 days' vacation after 5 years' service; 1 additional day for each year after 15 years' service, maximum 30 days
Revise New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad Agreement
Maximum of 15 days' vacation per year and 10 days' sick leave per year
Payment of vacation time of deceased employee, due and not used, to widow or family of deceased
Wage rates of Stores Department, Laborers, Janitors, Freight Handlers, etc. to receive upward adjustment
Equalize wage rates and establish uniform wage scales
80% of employees to be assigned regular positions; free system transportation passes after 15 years' service
Employees working between 6:00 pm and 7:00 am to receive 10% higher rate
Organize and secure Agreement covering wages and working conditions on Canadian National Express
10 days' vacation for 1-5 years' service; 15 days for 5-10 years' service
Status report on grievances every 30 days
Amend National Vacation Agreement to provide payment of time and one-half if employee is required to work his scheduled vacation period
Amend Section 8 of Vacation Agreement to provide payment of all earned vacation time upon death of employee
Inaugurate national movement to incorporate free transportation pass rights into existing Agreements
Grand President to render prompt replies and status reports on all pending cases, claims or grievances
Status reports on grievances to be made to Local and Division Chairmen; no agreements or settlements to be made until they have concurrence of Local and Division Chairmen
Utilization of Labor's manpower in economic and political planning and administration
Amend Vacation Agreement to provide families of deceased employees vacation pay earned by deceased employee
Complete Rules Agreement coverage of all groups represented by Brotherhood
Amend Vacation Agreement to provide families of deceased employees vacation pay earned by deceased employee

Ascertain reasons for the difference between number of free transportation passes granted by Western Lines and smaller number of passes granted by Eastern Lines and why passes are restricted on desirable trains
Grand Lodge to advocate and promote more uniform interpretations and demand wholehearted cooperation from Local Lodges and System Board Grievance Committees
3 weeks' vacation with pay after 15 years' service
Pay at rate of time and one-half in lieu of vacation not granted
5 days' vacation after 1 year's service to 15 days after 5 years; after 15 years 1 additional day for each year of service with a maximum of 30 days
15 and 20 days' vacation after 10 and 15 years' service
Secure agreement guaranteeing full employment rights to all returning service veterans
Rights of employees to free transportation to be fully restored
Amend National Vacation Agreement to protect rights of employees temporarily dismissed
Dispense with System, District and Terminal Boards of Adjustment Annual Meetings if financial conditions do not permit
Grand President to endeavor to devise ways to permit employee participation in insurance plans giving sickness, accident, hospital and surgical benefits at least cost
Secure increase in wages; double-time for Sunday work; paid holidays; longer vacations; sick leave
Rules changes for Railway Express Agency
5 days' vacation after 1 year's service to 10 days after 5 years; 1 additional day for each year after 12 years, with a maximum of 30 days
Seek immediate cost-of-living bonus in Canada; limit period to complete negotiations of new agreement to 90 days; make union dues payable by all employees who benefit by increased wage
1 additional day's vacation for each year after 15 years' service, maximum 30 days
National Sick Leave Rule based on present vacation rules with cumulative benefits up to 5 years
Straight-time pay for holidays not worked; time and one-half pay when worked
Amend Railway Labor Act to provide that negotiations must be concluded in 8 days from time notices are filed
System Boards of Adjustment required to meet in cities served by carrier
Class II employees to be paid for 7 legal holidays
Class II employees to receive 2 weeks' vacation with pay after 5 years' service; 3 weeks after 10 years
Company to pay for union representatives for policing Agreement
Secure more liberal free transportation for Railway Express Agency employees
10% wage differential for work after 9:00 pm
3 week's vacation with pay for employees with 25 years' service
Liberalization of free pass privileges; no restrictions to employees with 25 years' service
Soo Line System Board of Adjustment to inaugurate negotiations to acquire rule granting employees paid holidays
Amend Retirement Act to reduce retirement age of male employees to 60
Amend Unemployment Insurance Act to liberalize benefits
3 weeks' vacation after 10 years' service; National Sick Leave Rule; equalize rates of pay on all roads; retirement age of 60
15 days' sick leave; amend Unemployment Insurance Act to eliminate 7-day waiting period
Secure guarantees that Brotherhood has jurisdiction over all freight entering or leaving freight house or train depot
Retirement annuity to be based on earnings of five highest years at half pay and 30 years of service regardless of age
Compulsory retirement at age 65 or with 30 years' service at least with $100 per month minimum
Double-time over regular basic rate to be paid if employee required to work during vacation period
Payment of all earned vacation time upon termination of employment
Revise National Vacation Agreement to provide 1 additional day vacation for each year after 10 years' service

Revise National Vacation Agreement to provide credit for armed service employees for any year or part thereof, after his induction into service the same as if that employee had rendered the required service to the carrier
Employee to be paid time and one-half if required to work his regular vacation
Revise National Vacation Agreement to provide for payment of all earned vacation time upon the death of an employee
National Holiday Agreement providing pro-rata pay for 7 holidays if employees are not worked, double-time pay for employees required to work
Worship Day to be known as Brotherhood of Railway Clerks Worship Day
If member makes contribution to Railway Labor's Political League in the equivalent of one month's dues, Lodge may waive their share of per capita tax
Organize Bus Line employees and place under provisions of Railway Labor Act
Pay for all holidays not worked; double-time pay when worked; double-time for all work performed on Sundays
1 day's vacation for each year's service over 10 years; vacations to be figured on seniority rather than compensated service
Adjust existing rates of pay on each system to highest rate paid for class of work performed
Negotiate Sick Leave Agreement providing 5 days' sick leave after 1 year's service, 10 days after 3 years; sick leave to be accumulated up to 30 days' leave per year
Retirement at age 60 or after 30 years' service; increase widow's or survivors' annuity
Oppose separate pension system for Grand Lodge officers and other officers
Revise National Vacation Agreement concerning furloughed or extra employees
Oppose legislation permitting construction of conveyor belt
Revise Express Agreement in connection with vacations for Express Messengers
Employees with 2 or more years' service to be granted unrestricted passes on foreign lines
5 days' vacation after 1 year's service to 15 days after 15 years; thereafter 1 additional day for each year's service with a maximum of 30 days' vacation
Disabled employees to receive not less than 50 per cent of regular weekly wage from Workmen's Compensation
Employees to be paid at least once in every 14-day pay period
3 weeks' vacation for all members; paid holidays
Institute national movement to incorporate pass rights into existing Rules Agreement
Elect System Board Officers by referendum
5 days' vacation for 1 year's service to 15 days for 5-15 years; thereafter 1 additional day vacation each year with a maximum of 30 days
Stores Department to make deliveries of supplies to Using Department
Equalization of wage rates; night differential; 3 weeks' vacation after 15 years' service
5 days' vacation for 1 year's service to 15 days for 5-15 years; thereafter 1 additional day vacation each year with a maximum of 30 days
Revert Railway Clerk to magazine format
5 days' vacation for 1 year's service to 15 days for 5-15 years; thereafter 1 additional day vacation each year with a maximum of 30 days
Company to pay full-time for time employee serves as juror
Company to pay half cost of hospital and medical insurance for employees and their families
10 working days' vacation for 1-10 years' service; thereafter 1 additional day for each year with a maximum of 30 days
6 days' sick leave after 1 year's service, accumulative to 30 days
Secure agreement providing for pay for 7 legal holidays and in addition thereto include Election Day in a Presidential election year
Vacations based on seniority and length of service; sick leave with pay
Retirement at age 60 with 30 years' service
When retired because of disability, employee to receive $150 per month disability annuity without penalty
Reduce retirement age to 60; increase retirement pay to offset increased living costs
Retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service
Retirement after 30 years' service regardless of age
Increase benefits under Railroad Retirement Act
Pay for 7 legal holidays; time and one-half if required to work
Additional vacation allowance for employees with 10 or more years' service
Sick leave based on years of service
Express Board of Adjustment to be recreated
Consolidations, coordinations, abandonments or dissolutions of existing facilities
Payment of all earned vacation time upon termination of employee's service
Employees with 10 years' service to receive 15 days' vacation; 20 days for 20 years
Revise Sick Leave Agreements to provide that if any portion of sick leave allowance is not taken in current year, same may be accumulated to a total of 30 days
Revise Rules Agreement concerning violations, Railway Express Agency
Amend National Vacation Agreement to provide that employee shall be paid time and one-half if required to work during scheduled vacation period
Secure pay for holidays; work on holidays to be paid at two and one-half times regular rate
More effective and prompter handling of grievances
15 days' vacation for 10 years' service, 20 days for 20 years, Railway Express Agency
Secure more liberal free transportation pass privileges, Railway Express Agency
Negotiation of Sick Leave Rule for employees of Railway Express Agency
Safety measures; heaters in refrigerator cars
Highway Motor Transportation Division to be established within the Grand Lodge
Importation of foreign labor into the United States for agricultural purposes
Retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service; 3 weeks' vacation after 10 years' service; National Sick Leave Agreement
Establish scholarships as memorial to pioneer members and members who gave their all for the principles of justice
Punitive wage rates for overtime, Sunday and holiday work
More effective and prompter handling of grievances
Better cooperation and coordination of efforts of Local Lodges and System Boards of Adjustment
Consolidations, coordinations, abandonments, or dissolutions of existing facilities
Excepted or personal office force positions.
Appeals to Grand President, Grand Executive Council and Grand Lodge Convention
Organizing activities of System Boards and Local Lodges
Safety requirements for natural gas pipelines
Retirement at age 60 or after 30 years' service
Free transportation for employees of Railway Express Agency
Reduce vacation hours for furloughed employees from 2032 to 750
Delegates required to pay railroad fare to convention to be refunded costs
More effective and prompter handling of grievances
Funds and securities of System Boards of Adjustment
80-90% of jobs below Class I to be assigned as regular assigned jobs
Revise Rules Agreement with Railway Express Agency
Amend Selective Service Act to properly protect employment rights of returning servicemen
Amend Retirement Act to provide earlier retirement age and more adequate benefits
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide that a widow, married at least 10 years, receive 75% of pension to which her husband was entitled
Retirement at age 60 or after 30 years' service
Compulsory retirement age to be reduced to 60
Retirement after 30 years' service regardless of age; increase sick and retirement benefits by 25%
Oppose policy of Railroad Retirement Board requiring applicants for sick benefits to give information about their race or color
Earlier retirement age and more adequate benefits
Lower retirement age to 60, with full benefits after 30 years; increase pension benefits
National Sick Leave Agreement providing 10 days each year without restriction
Express Messengers to be transferred with their work to over-the-road truck service, with seniority rights unimpaired
Negotiate Agreement providing for a 6-hour day Monday through Friday
National Agreement providing free hospitalization for employees
Reduce vacation hours of furloughed employees from 2032 to 750
Free transportation for employees of Railway Express Agency
When Railway Express Agency pay day falls on Saturday, Sunday, or holiday, employees to be paid the day before
Amend Unemployment Insurance Act to liberalize unemployment and sickness benefits
Payment for holidays for all groups represented by Brotherhood
Sick leave and holiday pay for all railroad workers
15 days' vacation for employees with 6-19 years' service; 20 days for 20-29 years' 30 days for 30 or more years
Negotiate National Sick Leave Agreement permitting sick leave time to be accumulated up to 90 days
Amend Railway Labor Act to speed up wage negotiations.
Negotiate Agreement providing pay for holidays
All Agreements entered into be made subject to ratification of Local Lodges
Liberalize benefits provided for in National Vacation Agreement
5 days' vacation after 1 year's service; 10 days after 5-10 years; thereafter 1 additional day for each year
Improve foreign line trip passes on national basis
Better cooperation and coordination of efforts of Lodges and System Boards; rescind Resolution No. 163 on page 123 of Grand Lodge Constitution, effective July 1, 1947
Carriers be required to pay employees when required to render jury service
3 days' leave of absence with pay for death in family
Increase sickness and unemployment benefits under Unemployment Insurance Act
Members are ineligible to become Lodge officers and committeemen if delinquent in dues or engaged in illegal gambling activities or illegal money lending
7 legal holidays with pay; time and one-half if worked
Paid holidays for all employees covered by our Agreements
Negotiate Sick Leave Agreement with railroads providing for payment for first day of illness to the end of period not covered by Unemployment Insurance Act
Reduction of Parcel Post weight and size
Free transportation for Railway Express Agency employees
Consolidations, transfer or dissolution of work or facilities
Assure Express employees the right to all express work on trains, trucks, buses, terminal points where Railway Express Agency subcontracts it or uses trainmen to perform Express Agency work
Retain segregation of Group I and II employees
Sponsor legislation limiting size of trucks, speed; maintain adequate brakes
Inaugurate wage-increase movement when opportunity arises
Inaugurate a movement to provide paid holidays
Negotiate Sick Leave Rule providing pay for all time lost
No discrimination in free transportation on account of race, creed or color
Abolish restriction on all free transportation annual passes
No discrimination between white and colored mail and baggage handlers
3 weeks' vacation for employees with 15 or more years' seniority
Free transportation for widows of deceased employees
Railway Express Agency employees to be accorded same free transportation privileges as railroad employees
Refrain from participation in legislation concerning rates applying to Parcel Post
Payroll deduction of Union Shop dues and assessments
Lodge Officers ineligible to serve if engaged in illegal activities or illegal money lending
Rescind action requiring annual System Board meeting
Combine roster of Express Messengers and over-the-road truck employees
80-90 percent of jobs below Class I be set as regular assigned jobs
Express appreciation to City of San Francisco, California
Express appreciation to Southern Pacific Railway, Union Pacific Railway, Chicago and Northwestern Railway, Santa Fe Railway and other railroads for special equipment to Convention
Revise National Vacation Agreement to provide a maximum of 20 days per year
Remove restrictions on issuance of foreign line free transportation passes
